body_html:
TensorFlow is known to use a lot of memory when copying constants with frozen graphs. The best way to solve this is to memory-map the file, as described here under Reducing Memory Footprint:
https://www.tensorflow.org/mobile/optimizing

Alexnet is a very old model at this point though, and I'd highly recommend looking at a more modern version like MobileNet that can achieve better accuracy with a much smaller file size.

Alexnet is a very old model at this point though, and I'd highly recommend looking at a more modern version like MobileNet that can achieve better accuracy with a much smaller file size.
body:
TensorFlow is known to use a lot of memory when copying constants with frozen graphs. The best way to solve this is to memory-map the file, as described here under Reducing Memory Footprint:
https://www.tensorflow.org/mobile/optimizing

Alexnet is a very old model at this point though, and I'd highly recommend looking at a more modern version like MobileNet that can achieve better accuracy with a much smaller file size.
